groundtruth: The melanoma arm is focused on patients who have previously received anti-PD-(L)1 therapy and shown progression. The combination of VV1 and cemiplimab aims to evaluate the anti-tumor activity and safety in this specific patient population.

The head and neck SCC arm is tailored for patients who have not received prior anti-PD-(L)1 treatment. The combination of VV1 and cemiplimab aims to assess the efficacy and safety in this specific cohort.

The colorectal carcinoma arm is designed for patients who have progressed on standard therapies. The combination of VV1 and cemiplimab aims to evaluate the anti-tumor activity and safety in this specific patient population.

Certainly! Here are the full study arms:
1. Experimental: Melanoma intratumoral
Participant Group/Arm: Melanoma patients
Intervention/Treatment: IT VV1 + IV cemiplimab

2. Experimental: Head and Neck SCC intratumoral
Participant Group/Arm: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma patients
Intervention/Treatment: IT VV1 + IV cemiplimab

3. Experimental: Colo-rectal Carcinoma intratumoral
Participant Group/Arm: Colorectal cancer patients
Intervention/Treatment: IT VV1 + IV cemiplimab
You're welcome! If you have any more questions or need further clarification, feel free to ask.
